name: BEST WESTERN Carlton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst up for the football and meeting family. It is in a good location, right on the sea front on North Parade , about a 15 min walk to the tower and the bus and trams stop right outside. Rooms were fine, good size and comfy beds. Breakfast was great , a buffet with a wide choice and quality ingredients. You could do a lot worse than stay here
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Stayed here Fri 31st Aug 2012 for one night for Illuminations , booked 2 rooms 1 Double and 1 Twin room for kids .Hotel was very clean and staff very friendly.
reviews.title: 2012 Illuminations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms compact but reasonable size , well equipped.
reviews.title: Clean and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was buffet style and all 4 of our party rated it as excellent .
reviews.title: mid week break

reviews.text: Overall would definitely recommend and without doubt would stay there again .
reviews.title: A bit dated but ok. Nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, we had a sea view - £10 per night extra. However, the room suffered with severe damp problems, with wall paper becoming loose, damp patches on the ceiling and walls adjacent to the bow window.
reviews.title: Faded Opulence !!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was a joke. This hotel is suppose to be rated as 4 star, but we had to obtain our tea and coffee from two separate urns, and the toast machine was of the electric conveyor type found in package holiday hotels in Spain or Greece. The breakfast menu said that there was mixed fruit available, which consisted of two large bowls, one with a few grapefruit segments floating in and the other had about 6 slices of pineapple.
reviews.title: An excellent base

reviews.text: Absolutely no service to the table at all, and the only work the staff did was to take away your plates, etc., when you had finished. We witnessed a waiter picking up a used side plate, brush the toast crumbs onto the carpet, and then replace the plate. (the reporter from the TV programme 'The Hotel Inspector would have a field day here)
reviews.title: Good Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was built at the turn of the century - which one ?. The interior decoration was gloomy and totally out of date, it needed some surgery to up-date the ambience. It certainly was not worth the £110 per night that we were charged, and I would not recommend this hotel at all despite other visitors giving a more favourable report.
reviews.title: A good hotel stay in Blackpool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just got back from a couple of nights at the Best Western Carlton Hotel and really had a lovely time. We had a large bedroom and bathroom over looking the seafront which had everything you could possibly need for a comfortable stay. The staff were courteous, friendly and efficient and nothing was too much trouble to them. Dinner and breakfast were excellent - a varied choice at both with good presentation. You can forget the car and leave it in the car park at the hotel which is in an ideal location across the road from bus and tram stops and within easy walking distance from all the attractions Blackpool has to offer. If you are looking for a relaxing base we would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Thank you for our perfect stay and wedding reception

reviews.text: Was staying in the carleton for one night. Monday .July 18 2012.Was over for a business trip.i found the lady on the fround desk very rude. I payed by vista and the bill was wrong by two pound. her falth. i said i would pay it by cash. because it was only two pound. i said i drop it back to her .But when i got back to her in around ten minutes .She already taken it from my vista. Not nice.The room i booked was a single bedroom. I must say it was a very small single bedroom. And the bathroom was small aswell.The bed i must say was very clean .Like the room and bathroom..The next morning i had breakfast. i was down around eight ..The food was very good.But i think only two hours for breakfast. is a bit of a short time. i think it should be serve up to eleven.Over all i found the staff very rude. and not helpfull.
reviews.title: Will not go back
Hoped for better
reviews.text: I normally stay at Premier Inn, mainly for price and consistency but thought I would branch out and try something different, I wish I hadn't. My main gripe was the bathroom, room, may be an exaggeration, it was more like a cupboard, I have never seen a hotel bathroom so small. The room did have a sea view but the window was very small making the room quite gloomy. The hotel does not provide glasses in the room, just plastic cups. When these were not replaced, I asked at reception and none could be found. A while later ONE plastic cup was delivered to our room, presumably for us to share! I am sure there are nice rooms at this hotel, why we didn't get one I don't know, it wasn't that busy when we were there. On a plus note the breakfasts were good and the service was friendly, but it will be back to Premier Inn for me next time.

The best western Carlton hotel meets the criteria of a best western any were in the world as a business man i travel extensively and say without hesitation this hotel is good and i enjoyed my stay very friendly staff and marvelous facilities, the morning breakfast was a total hit with me full options including a perfectly cooked full english and large selection of beverages, i shall be returning to this perfect little gem on my next business trip.
reviews.title: Perfect little gem my stay was fully enjoyed

reviews.text: I have just had the most lovley stay at the carlton everything from the rooms to the food and the service were exellant, i would stay here again it would be my first selection thanks guys.
reviews.title: Good hotel nice rooms good price lovley staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Carlton for three nights in June 1012. We landed an excellent deal on booking.com.
reviews.title: Nice hotel.

reviews.text: stayed here for 2 nights for the rebellion festival in winter gardens. hotel only about 10 mins walk from the venue. hotel very quiet. rooms small but not uncomfortably so, no doors banging against beds or anything like that when you open the bedroom door! rooms v clean. hotel itself was extremely quiet, even in the bar. never tried the restaurant, but the bar food wasn't great. usual complaints of hall doors banging early in the morning and shower water temperature being a bit difficult to control (i think this is a universal problem with hotels at this stage!!) but other than that, grand!! will stay there again.
reviews.title: good hotel!

reviews.text: Just returned from staying a week here and must say I was really pleased overall with the place. I am a disabled traveller and find it very difficult to get accommodation which is wheelchair friendly , especially in Blackpool. The ramp at the front door makes entry easy but the double doors are quite hard to open when you are seated. Automatic ones would be so much easier. On arrival I was greeted with Tina at reception who couldn't have been any nicer. I asked to see the room first just in case it wasn't what I was expecting but on viewing it was adequate, quite small but clean and having a walk in shower was a bonus. My luggage was brought up for me from the car, the same on departure . Also a lift to all floors. I was only bed and breakfast and going by the quality and selection they had to offer I know all meals would have been great. I will be coming back next year as this hotel is a little jem at a reasonable price, quite hard to find in Blackpool nowadays unless your willing to pay through the nose for it. I would love it if they could make those doors easier though......
reviews.title: Very Surprised

reviews.text: Stayed here 2yrs ago and loved it, we went back april 2012 and it was totally different the rooms havnt been updated the carpets worn and the staff were so ignorant,at breakfast we were shown to table but then just left there, i had to ask other guests do we help our self to food as no one told us. the reception staff were all quite abrupt and didnt seem to enjoy working here. 2yrs ago the reception lady was so helpful she couldnt of done more the staff were kind and very helpful
reviews.title: going downhill

reviews.text: i just feel its lost its spark.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: we went to the indian restaurant there was a english girl in there she was nice but we waited an hour for starters she did keep saying sorry for the wait so we didnt complain
reviews.title: I have just had a very brill stay 8 nights of bliss

description: Be right beside the seaside! The Best Western Carlton Hotel enjoys a fantastic seafront location, overlooking the beautiful Fylde coast. Though you’ll enjoy the quiet setting of the Northern Promenade here, you’ll be just minutes from the centre of Blackpool and its many attractions. Built at the turn of the century, the Best Western Carlton Hotel boasts panoramic scenery across the Irish Sea, as well as a ‘front row’ view along 12 miles of sandy beaches and the famous Golden Mile! Be our guest in Blackpool. A leisurely stroll will take you to the town Centre and Winter Gardens, and Blackpool’s best bits are within easy reach! 1 mile from Blackpool Tower with 5 new attractions, 3 miles from The Pleasure Beach, 5 miles from Blackpool Airport, 1 mile from the Sea Life Centre, 2 miles from Madame Tussauds, 0 miles from The Beach! There are lots of shopping opportunities nearby in the city centre, and at Hound’s Hill Shopping Centre. Find out more about locations near the Best Western Carlton Hotel. Best Western Carlton Hotel at a glance. Whether you’re here with the family or spending time with that special someone, you can look forward to a warm Lancashire welcome! Our Values: Our aim is simple – we want to make sure your stay is as enjoyable, relaxing and memorable as possible. Our friendly staff will go out of their way to meet your every need, so for the warmest of welcomes, be our guest!
